properties.headline: Flood Watch issued February 20 at 2:14PM EST until February 21 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Columbia SC
properties.description:
...Flood Watch...

.Saturated soil and some lowland flooding has occurred in Burke
County. Additional rainfall of 1 to 1.5 inches is forecast through
this evening. Localized higher amounts may occur leading to more
serious flooding. Significant rain will end this evening, but
flooding issues may continue.

The Flood Watch continues for

* A portion of east central Georgia, including the following
area, Burke County.

* Until 1 AM EST Friday

* Moderate to occasionally heavy rain is forecast through this
evening. General rain totals of 1 to 1.5 inches are forecast.
Locally higher amounts may occur leading to more serious
flooding.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on
current forecasts.

Do not drive on flooded roads. It takes little water to move a
vehicle off the road and into deeper water. Also, the road bed
may not be intact under flood waters.

You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible
Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be
prepared to take action should flooding develop.

NWSheadline: FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST FRIDAY MORNING
